name: WCSU RA Colonial Carnival
caption: A web application designed for students at Western Connecticut State University (WCSU).
summary: Colonial Carnival is a web application designed for students at WCSU to play anywhere! Residents are able to earn marbles (points) and exchange them for a variety of prizes. This web application is also my very first web application. I took on the challenge of building this web application with vanilla javascript in order to learn the fundamentals of web development. Due to COVID-19, the development of this application was put to a halt.
notes: Colonial Carnival is a web application designed for students at WCSU to play anywhere! Residents are able to earn marbles (points) and exchange them for a variety of prizes.
This web application is also my very first personal project. I took on the challenge of building this web application with vanilla JavaScript in order to learn the fundamentals of web development.

Because of COVID-19, the enhancement of this application was put to a halt. As a Resident Assistant juggling many other responsibilities I was not able to focus on improving the application throughout the semester. The main focus was to make sure that the students were able to move out of the residential building safely.
There were 35 active users!
The idea of using marbles as a point system came from my Fitness Jar activity
This is my first experience using Firebase.
Each game within Colonial Carnival targets one of the Housing and Residence Life programming types (iMatter, Cultural Awareness, Current Event, & Social)
I want to give a big thank you to the Housing and Residence Life team for their input on improving the quality of this application

name: Chev's Escape
caption: An object oriented software engineering class project (2019).
summary: Chev's Escape is a class project focused on building an object oriented program with 4-5 other students. The goal for this project is to create a video game without the use of a pre-exisitng game engine such as Unity.
notes: Chev's Escape is a class project focused on building an object oriented program with 4-5 other students. The goal for this project is to create a video game without the use of a pre-exisitng game engine such as Unity.
Chev's Escape is about the professor Dr. Ganchev who needs to solve a number of puzzles in order to escape the Computer Science building
I took on the role as the team lead.
We used WinForms 2019 to bring this game to life.

name: GITRG MOCAP 2018-2019
caption: A cost effective motion capturing system
summary: The goal of this project was to design a cost-effective motion capture system using “off the shelf” components and custom designed software. The project uses Raspberry Pi 3 computers for development but targets Raspberry Pi Zeroes for deployment. The system also uses NoIR cameras for computer vision purposes. The software is written in Python and utilizes the OpenCV computer vision library.
notes: The goal of this project was to design a cost-effective motion capture system using “off the shelf” components and custom designed software.

The project uses Raspberry Pi 3 computers for development but targets Raspberry Pi Zeroes for deployment. The system also uses NoIR cameras for computer vision purposes. The software is written in Python and utilizes the OpenCV computer vision library.

name: GITRG 3D Crayon 2019-2020
caption: An open source intelligent toy which allows someone to draw in a 3D space
summary: An open source intelligent toy product that allows an individual to draw in a 3D space.
notes: An open source intelligent toy which allows someone to draw in a 3D space
This project is in the design phase as of 3/26/20.

name: Revealing Roc
caption: An embedded systems class project
summary: Revealing Roc is an Intro to Embedded Systems project that utilizes an Arduino Nano and various components. The software is written in the programming language C++. It is a handheld game that instructs the user to find the hidden rock.
notes: Revealing Roc is an Intro to Embedded Systems project that uses an Arduino Nano and other components.
Revealing Roc is a 'Hide and Seek' like game across a 4x4 RGB LED board where the player has to find the spot that the "Roc" is hidden. The player has three chances to guess correctly.

name: Paw Bytes
caption: A three part project that incorporates a Twitter bot, database, and website.
summary: A three part personal project which models a fictional restaurant. The project involved the development of a Twitter Bot, database, and web application.
notes: Paw Bytes is my first full stack web application.
This project started off as a database project and grew to be something bigger!
Thank you to everyone who submitted pictures of their cats and dogs!

After struggling with CS205 (Intro to Database Management Systems) and barely passing I made a decision to revisit the material whenever I can. During my last semester, I asked my professor if I could sit in their database class from time to time while working on this project.
After completing the database for this project, I wanted to do more. I wanted to take the chance to learn React so I used it to build the website for this project.

I was having a lot of fun seeing it come together and wanted to push myself even further. At the time I was interested in familiarizing myself with Python. So I decided to create a Twitter Bot with it (with the help of CS Dojo!).

name: Lovely Feathers
caption: A web application that gives people the opportunitiy to spread kindness.
summary: Lovely Feathers is an application that gives people the opportuninity to spread kindness through the act of passing a card (feather) containing a kind message. A card is referred to as a feather throughout the application. This application is still in development as of March 11th 2021. Since 2020 was such a very difficult and negative year, I wanted to create an application that gives an opportunity to provide people with a unique form of positivity.
notes: Lovely Feathers is an application that gives people the opportuninity to spread kindness through the act of passing a card (feather) containing a kind message. A card is referred to as a feather throughout the application.
This application is still in development as of March 11th 2021.
Since 2020 was such a very difficult and negative year, I wanted to create an application that gives people an opportunity to spread a bit of kindness.

name: Twinlande Superstore
notes: Twilnade Superstore is fullstack web project that I am building with the Rocstory community.
Twin sisters Dlo & Dife want a website for their store Twinlande.
[UIUX component] I have a huge appreciation for UIUX developers/designers and thought that this would be a fun way for me to learn more about it.

[Social Media component] I wanted to start creating content about tech and I came up with the idea of building a web application from the ground up with the help of people on social media. As someone who is not too comfortable with being on camera and putting myself out there, I figured this would be a fun way to step out of my shell.
